alert.note: Alert for Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 20 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Mainland Monroe and central Miami-Dade Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shark Valley Obs Tower, or 18 miles northwest of Homestead General Airport, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shark Valley Obs Tower, Fortymile Bend and Everglades National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
